cheatsheet.title: Defining connections to SAP systems and Information Server instances

intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to define connections to SAP systems and / or Information Server instances. If your Information Server instance has SAP connections defined (created with, e.g., the DataStage Administrator for SAP) you can re-use these connections in Rapid Modeler and Rapid Generator.

item.title: Open the SAP Pack Connections View
item.description:
In the main toolbar, go to Window > Show View > Other. Search for the category InfoSphere for SAP and select SAP Pack connections.
Click OK.

item.title: Determine the connection type
item.description:
The SAP Pack Connections View offers two ways of creating connections to SAP systems:
1. Local: This is a connection that is only known in your workspace. This is the best choice if you don't work with Information Server.
2. Information Server connection: If you have an Information Server somewhere in your environment and you have SAP connections defined there (e.g. with the DataStage Administrator for SAP tool of the DataStage components of the SAP Packs) you can re-use these connections here. This is typically the best choice if you work with Conversion Workbench for SAP.
The next two steps describe in detail how connections are created for these connection types.

item.title: Create a local SAP connection
item.description: In the SAP Pack connections view, right click on Local SAP Connections and select New.... Enter all necessary information in the panel that opens and click OK to save.

item.title: Create an Information Server connection
item.description:
In the SAP Pack connections view, right click on Information Server Connections and select New.... Enter all necessary information in the panel that opens and click OK to save.
If you expand the Information Server connection in the view, you will see all SAP connections defined on this Information Server instance under the folder DataStage SAP Connections.
